intro: Urceolina plicata subsp. brevidentata, commonly known as the narrow-toothed urceolina, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, pinnately divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. It is native to specific regions in South America, particularly in the Andean foothills. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
